message.content:
We need to determine the accumulated depreciation “balance‐sheet item” – that is, the total depreciation that has been recorded across the transactions. In our example the only initial transaction lines (the “Initial…” ones) did not include any accumulated depreciation (so the beginning accumulated depreciation is zero). Then we scan for transactions whose type is “Depreciation.”

Looking through the provided transactions we identify two such depreciation entries:

1. A depreciation recorded on 2024‑01‑01 with an amount of 45749.96.
2. A depreciation recorded on 2024‑02‑01 with an amount of 75220.2.

Because there is no carried‑over depreciation from any “initial” accumulated depreciation account (the balance before any depreciation is zero), the beginning balance is 0.00. Then, the accumulated (cumulative) depreciation at the end of the period is the sum of the depreciation recorded in these two transactions:

  45749.96 + 75220.2 = 120970.16

Thus, the answer is:

{"solution": {"Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00", "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "120970.16"}}
